</acronyms>    <glossary-terms/>    <faqs>       <faq ccid="42501"            type=""            last-modified="2014-01-07T10:36:21"            created="2010-10-15T10:49:03">          <faq-date>2010-10-16</faq-date>          <faq-author>Dolinger Few, Lauren M</faq-author>          <question>What is the difference between catch and landings</question>          <answer>Landings include only harvested fish. Catch includes released/discarded fish and landings.</answer>       </faq>       <faq ccid="42504"            type=""            last-modified="2014-01-07T10:27:47"            created="2010-10-15T11:48:10">          <faq-date>2010-10-16</faq-date>          <faq-author>Dolinger Few, Lauren M</faq-author>          <question>What is the difference between fisheries independent data and fisheies dependent data</question>          <answer>Fishery dependent data are collected directly from the commercial and recreational harvester. When fisheries scientists collect fisheries information independent of commercial or recreational fishing operations, this information is considered fisheries-independent data.</answer>       </faq>    </faqs>    <downloads/>    <related-items>       <item cat-id="10574" cat-type="DS" relation-type="HI">          <title>FOSS Public Data Set</title>          <abstract>The purpose of the Fisheries One-Stop-Shop (FOSS) is to make fisheries dependent information readily available to fisheries managers, scientists and the American public at a national as well as regional level.  Collection and management of fisheries dependent data are distributed throughout NOAA Fisheries, State Fisheries, management agencies and regional Fisheries Information Networks (FINs).  The distributed nature of NOAA Fisheries information systems, differences in collection authorities and confidentiality requirements increases the importance of this flexible technical architecture that can meet the changing needs for information at national, regional and local levels of resolution.  At the same time, the technical architecture is scalable to meet enterprise wide requirements for management of other types of fisheries data and fisheries independent data. Currently available via FOSS are the summarized, non-confidential, annual Commercial Landings by state as provided through the Atlantic Coastal Cooperative Statistics Program (ACCSP), the Gulf of Mexico Fisheries Information Network (GulfFIN).  Recreational Landings estimates are available and provided via NMFS Headquarters.  In FY2011, FOSS will be expanded to include all commercial landings nationally.</abstract>       </item>       <item cat-id="10579" cat-type="PRJ" relation-type="RI">          <title>FOSS 1.x System Documentation</title>          <abstract>FOSS 1.x System Documentation</abstract>          <relation-note>FOSS System Documentation</relation-note>       </item>    </related-items>    <fgdc-contacts>       <fgdc-contact role="Point of Contact">          <contact-type>cntper</contact-type>          <contact-person-name>Lewis, Michael T</contact-person-name>          <contact-org-name>NMFS Office of Science and Technology</contact-org-name>          <address-type>MAILING</address-type>          <street-address>1315 East West Hwy, SSMC3, Room 12621</street-address>          <city>Silver Spring</city>          <state-prov>MD</state-prov>          <zip>20910-3282</zip>          <country>USA</country>          <email>michael.t.lewis@noaa.gov</email>          <voice>301-427-8146</voice>          <fax>301-713-1875</fax>          <instructions>Phone or Email   </instructions>       </fgdc-contact>    </fgdc-contacts>    <fgdc-time-period>       <timeperd>          <timeinfo>             <rngdates>                <begdate/>                <begtime/>                <enddate/>                <endtime/>             </rngdates>          </timeinfo>          <current/>       </timeperd>    </fgdc-time-period>    <publisher>       <person-contact-info>          <name>Dolinger Few, Lauren M</name>          <address-type>MAILING</address-type>          <street-address>1315 East-West Hwy, SSMC3, Room 12336</street-address>          <city>Silver Spring</city>          <state-prov>MD</state-prov>          <zip>20910-3282</zip>          <country/>          <email>lauren.dolinger.few@noaa.gov</email>          <phone>301-427-8127</phone>          <fax>301-713-4137</fax>       </person-contact-info>    </publisher> </catalog-item>
